gurmukhi: p`Cm sUr cVXo sunIXY aultI iPir gMg bhI Ab AwvY ]s`iq tirE hrIcMd hUM ko DrnIDr iqAwg Drw qy prwvY ]
transliteration: Pachchham Soor Chadyo Souneeyai Ultiphir(i) Gadg Bahiab Aavai|| Satt(i) Tario Dareechannd Hoon Ko Dharrneedhar Tiaag Dharaa Te Paraavai||
translation: The sun can rise from the west, the Ganges can flow backwards, Harish Chandra can fall down from his truth, the mountains can flee and leave the earth,

gurmukhi: isMG clY miRg qy tir kY gjrwj aufXo nB mwrg jwvY ]pwrQ sXwm khXo qb BUpq qRws BrY nih juDu mcwvY ]2323]
transliteration: Singh Chalai Mrig Te Tar(i) Kai Gadraaj Udyo Nabh Maarag Jaavai|| Paarath Syaam Kahyo Tab Bhoopat Traas Bdarai Nah(i) Juddh(u) Machaavai||2323||
translation: The lion can be frightened by a deer and the elephant can fly but Arjuna said, “I think, if all this happens, the king is so much frightened that he cannot wage a war;”2323.

gurmukhi: pwrQ jo biRjnwQ jbY kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq bKwno ]sRI biRjnwQ iehI ieh pwrQ BIm iehY iqh BUpiq jwno ]
transliteration: Paarath Jo Brijnaath Jabai Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Bakhaano|| Sribrijnaath Ehieh Paarath Bheem Ihai Tih Bhoopat(i) Jaano||
translation: When Arjuna said like this to Krishna, then the king thought that they were, in fact, Krishna, Arjuna and Bhima.

gurmukhi: kwnH BjXo hm qy ieh bwlk Xw sMg hO lirhO su bKwno ]ju`Du ky kwrn TwFo BXo auiT sXwm khY kCu qRws n mwno ]2324]
transliteration: Kaahn Bhajyo Ham Te Eh Baalak Yaa San Hau Larihau Su Bakhaano|| Juddh(u) Ke Kaaran Thaadho Bhayo Outh(i) Syaam Kahai Kachh(u) Traas Na Maano||2324||
translation: He said, “Krishna has fled before me, should I now fight with these children?” Saying this, he stood fearlessly for waging the war.2324.

gurmukhi: BwrI gdw huqI Dwm GnI iek BIm kO Awp ko Aaur mMgweI ]eyk deI kr BImih ky iek Awpny hwQ ky bIc suhweI ]
transliteration: Bhaarigadaa Houtidhaam Ghaniik Bheem Kau Aap Ko Aur Manadee|| Ek Daikar Bheemah(i) Ke Ik Aapane Haath Ke Beech Suhaaee||
translation: There was a very huge mace, in the house; the king caused to be brought for himself and gave the other to Bhima; he took his mace in his hand and the other mace was given in the hand of Bhima; the fight began;

gurmukhi: rwq ko soie rhY suK pwie su idvs krY auT in`q lrweI ]AYsy kQw duh bIrn kI mn bIc ibcwr kY sXwm sunweI ]2325]
transliteration: Raat Ko Soe Rahai Soukh Paae Su Divas Darai Outh Nit Laraaee|| Aise Kathaa Duh Bderan Kiman Beech Bichaar Kai Syaam Sounaaee||2325||
translation: They used to sleep at night and fight during the day and the story of the battle of both the warriors is related by the poet Shyam.2325.

gurmukhi: BIm gdw gih BUp pY mwrq BUp gdw gih BIm pY mwrI ]ros Bry blvMq doaU lrY kwnn mY jn kyhir BwrI ]
transliteration: Bheem Gadaa Gadh Bhoop Pai Maarat Bhoop Gadaa Gadh Bheem Pai Mdaree|| Ros Bhare Balvant Dooo Darai Kaanan Mai Jan Kehar(i) Bhdaree||
translation: Bhima strikes the mace on the king and the king given the blow with his mace to Bhima. Both the warriors are fighting in fury with such intensity as if two lions are fighting in the forest;

gurmukhi: ju`D krY n murY iqh Taur qy bwNtq hY iqh TwN jnXwrI ]XO aupjI aupmw cqury jn Kylq hY PulbwN so iKlwrI ]2326]
transliteration: Juddh Darai Na Murai Tih Thaur Te Baantat Hai Tih Thaan Janydaree|| Yau Oupjioupmaa Chature Jan Khelat Hai Phulbaan So Khildaree||2326||
translation: They are fighting and not moving away from their determined places; it seems that the sportsmen are standing stable while playing.2326.

gurmukhi: idvs sqweIs ju`Du BXo jb BUp ijqXo blu BImih hwrXo ]sRI biRjnwQ dXo qb hI blu ju`D ko kRoD kI Er pcwrXo ]
transliteration: Divas Sataaees Juddh(u) Bhayo Jab Bhoop Jityo Bal(u) Bheemah(i) Hdaryo|| Sribrijnaath Dayo Tab Hibal(u) Juddh Ko Krodh Kior Pachdaryo||
translation: After twenty-seven days of fighting, the king became victorious and Bhima was defeated; then Krishna gave his own strength to him and shouted in anger;
